tourBios.otherInfo: Will be playing his rookie season on the Nationwide Tour in 2007. Has missed the cut in all five career starts on Tour, with his last coming at the 2004 Peek'n Peak Classic. Has never played in a PGA TOUR event. Winner of 12 mini-tour events from 1997-2000. Has played on the Canadian Tour since 2000, winning the Eagle Creek Classic during his rookie season. Winner of the 1996 Ohio Open. Recently inducted into the John Carroll University Hall of Fame. Three-time All-American and 1996 Jack Nicklaus College Player of the Year Award winner at the Division III level. Four-time All-Conference honoree. Was an all-state tennis player during his high school career. Winning during his rookie season on the Canadian Tour is his biggest thrill in golf. Lists his parents—who gave him his start in golf at the age of 13—as his heroes. His wife, Elizabeth, is a doctor and has served on several mission trips to Guatemala. Worked on a driving range and also gave lessons while pursuing his dream of playing on the PGA TOUR.

dyn.dynResults: He has finished 1st on the Mackenzie Tour-PGA T 2 times.
